name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: I donâ€™t have an attitude towards â€œThe Three-Body Problemâ€ because I havenâ€™t watched it. However, I am quite interested in the recent debate on the â€œCultural Revolutionâ€ in â€œThe Three-Body Problemâ€. TV dramas can film the Cultural Revolution, but it does not represent true cultural freedom. It just means that certain dramas can express certain freedoms under certain circumstances. What the public wants is the freedom to discuss. These are two different things. If a TV drama can be filmed, but you only dare to use abbreviations to prevent your account from being blocked when defending it, do you think this is cultural freedom?
